result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Victor Evenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
 Cash bail to be applied.
-Fine is set at $1,800.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges,
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

-The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
-Serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with work release privileges.
 After 6 months served, defendant may petition the court for childcare release. The court does not object to electronic monitoring as determined by the House of Correction.
**01-03-17 Court ordered defendant eligible to earn Good Time Credit.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment (Denied), signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Joseph R. Wall, Br. 20, calendar successor, for review. spc
(Return address: Eric Evenson, Racine County Jail Contract, 717 Wisconsin Avenue, Racine, WI 53403).
Original GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (16 pages) commencing MAY 6, 2016, received and filed.  jm
Granting Request for Good Time Credit, signed and filed
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Associated with Charge #1
WCS INTOXICATED DRIVER INTERVENTION PROGRAM, FILED
Court orders the Confidential document sealed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Dragan O.

AS TO COUNT 1: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 26 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:


-Serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with work release privileges. After 6 months served, defendant may petition the court for childcare release. The court does not object to electronic monitoring as determined by the House of Correction. 
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail to be applied.
-Fine is set at $1,800.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges,
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-No driving without valid license.
-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 4 years. 
-Court ordered Ignition Interlock Devise for a period of 4 years. 

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
The defendant is remanded. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Pretrial Credit

Defendant Eric Victor Evenson in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Randy Sitzberger on behalf of Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell also present in court. Attorney Lebell has been privately retained and requested to substitute as counsel of record. Court granted attorney Lebell's request and allowed attorney Erickson to withdraw. Attorney Lebell has received discovery from prior counsel. Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. Parties to file motions by 10/02/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
